etymology.description: 好(好) (hǎo, "good") + 的(的) (de, "particle used for emphasis or possession")
etymology.interpretation: 好的 (hǎo de) is used to indicate agreement or affirmation, similarly to saying 'okay' or 'alright' in English. The character 好(好) (hǎo, "good") conveys a positive response, while 的(的) (de) is a particle that adds emphasis, making the phrase a polite and affirmative reply.

parts.english: particle used for emphasis or possession

examples.chinese: 我们明天见(我們明天見)，好的(好的)。
听到消息后(聽到消息後)，我说好的(我說好的)。
examples.pinyin: tīngdào xiāoxī hòu, wǒ shuō hǎo de.
examples.english: After hearing the news, I said alright.

examples.chinese: 如果你答应帮忙(如果你答應幫忙)，我会说好的(我會說好的)。
examples.pinyin: rúguǒ nǐ dāyìng bāngmáng, wǒ huì shuō hǎo de.
examples.english: If you agree to help, I will say okay.
